ratings.comment: Vlad was great! Tests had plenty of extra credit and were straight out of the homework. You could tell that he cared and really wanted to give you a good grade. His accent was pretty thick but not hard to understand. I highly recommend him

Didn't do the homework for the first exam...got a 35. Did the homework for the second...got a 100. If you do the homework problems, you will get an A in this class. DiffEq is very systematic, you just need to memorize how to solve the different types of equations. Very manageable class, even somewhat enjoyable...and I hated math before this class.

Eyderman was one of my favorite professors so far. The tests are very representative of what we learned in class and he doesn't put material you never learned on the tests,  unlike most math professors. It's a pretty stress-free class, but you still learn as much as any other math class. He makes sure everyone has enough time to finish the exams.
He is the best math teacher I have ever met in UW. He tried to give everyone a A, and he was really helpful.

The best, most caring professor I have ever had!  He really wants to know his students and tries to give everyone A's.  Definitely my favorite professor!  Tests are easy if you pay attention in class, so don't read the book.  He is extremely helpful in office hours!  I was sad to say goodbye to him. I really hope to take another class with him!!

Great prof. Very funny and cute. He gives great lectures and makes a boring class interesting. He has the best accent. His exams are easy if you know how to do what is covered in lecture. They all have extra credit. Don't buy the textbook.

Professor Eyderman is by far my favorite professor that I've EVER had at UW. He genuinely cares about his students and has many office hours for you to get help. He is absolutely adorable, easy going, and funny. His exams are extremely straight forward, and he offers lots of extra credit opportunities on them. SKIP THE BOOK. It's useless and HW opt

Awesome professor! Makes lecture entertaining but still does an excellent job teaching the material.  Tests are straightforward.  If you are even decent at math I recommend skipping the textbook.  Practice problems aren't turned in and explanations in the book are not helpful.  Highly recommend this class and professor!

Funny guy, helpful. Goes through material at a good pace. We got through probably 2/3 of the material you would normally have to go through for math 222. Also his tests aren't bad as long as you can do the hw without a problem. He makes math 222 much easier than it is.

Had him for Diff Eq and I loved him. Lectures are helpful because he goes through a lot of examples and he's hilarious. He gives a lot of EC which helps a lot. It's very easy to end up in the low end of the curve because his exams are very straightforward so people tend to do really well.

Great guy! My friend and I always joked that he would make a great neighbor! His exams were very straighforward and there wasn't anything surprising on them. His accent isn't that bad if you've ever heard a foreigner before.
willing to help and give a really easy final exam
